name: Hilton Garden Inn West Edmonton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton. The front desk and staff were friendly; the room was modern, clean, spacious and had all the amenities we wanted – tv & dvd player, mini fridge, big bathroom, lots of closet space, large parking lot. This hotel is a great location for anyone who wants to be close to West Edmonton Mall. It is literally a 5-7 minute drive to the mall. The front desk offered us cookies one day after we arrived back from shopping, and they were always courteous and polite! Would definitely recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Wonderful visit

reviews.text: While the hotel itself was average, close to WEM, it could use a little better trained staff. We booked through a third party site and then called ahead to request 2 Double beds, which we were assured we would receive. Upon arrival we were told they only had a King available but we could move the next day to Doubles, but they had a cot for us. Once in our room the night desk person arrived with extra blankets & pillow stating he couldn't find a cot. The next morning my husband went down to the desk at 8am and happened by an open housekeeping closet with a clean cot it in. They gave us free breakfast for our troubles. Went out for the day and when we returned we had been moved. Only they had NOT moved our daughter's teddy bear. We called the desk and they told us we'd have to wait til AM housekeepers came in. In the morning we spoke to the desk again and no one had seen her bear. We left the next day without the teddy bear and it still hasn't turned up. I am very skeptical as to how an almost 12inch rainbow colored bear goes missing and cannot be found. It was very upsetting to our little one and we left feeling extremely disappointed with the lack of apologies from any staff. Sent an email once we were home and received no reply. Only got a reply when sent second email to GM. I'd understand if it was a small item that got lost in laundry, but this was not the case. Would NOT return, nor reccomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Could've been handled better....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed as a couple and felt very welcomed right off the start. The appearance of the lobby was inviting and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast we ate the next morning was very good and the service was excellent. The location was very convenient for the mall and the restaurant we choose for that evening. Definitely would stay again for a future trip.
reviews.title: Very good and welcoming visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in Edmonton for about a week and had the most wonderful time. The staff were more than helpful,always friendly and so well trained. All our wishes were granted and we were made to feel so welcome. I had booked on line, thru a hotel.com, which was where my call went when I phoned the Hilton Garden Inn. When we arrived at the Hilton Inn, our reservation had not been made, but they accommodated us nonetheless, for which we are very grateful. We were on the 6th floor and had a panoramic view of the city. This stay was equal to our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Ottawa (airport). We will for sure stay with these hotels in the future - if there is one in our vicinity. Thank you Hilton Garden Inns.
reviews.title: the best

reviews.text: Good location in northwest Edmonton. Close to all the major roads and west edmonton mall. Great customer service. Breakfast is good, but expensive compared to the Dennys across the road. Great managers night with wine/beer and snacks.
reviews.title: Great location, Good service!

reviews.text: Exactly what I expected from a Hilton.
reviews.title: stayed before and would definitely stay again

reviews.text: Staff was professional and helpful
reviews.title: Decent hotel. Nice rooms. Good location on the west end of the city.

reviews.text: even though I'm not a sweets guy, the cookies at the front desk is a nice touch
reviews.title: Basic clean hotel

reviews.text: every time I called, the front desk answered promptly
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: internet speeds are acceptable
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights while on our honeymoon & we enjoyed it very much. We got the Stay & Play package and found the value to be excellent as we were planning on going to West Edmonton Mall to take in several of the attractions there. Our hotel room was very clean, loved the amenities in the bathroom, and once we adjusted our bed for our second night, we had a wonderful sleep--didn't hear any noise from the hall at all. We didn't eat at the restaurant as we chose to go to Red Lobster & The Keg which are located very nearby. We also didn't try out the pool or hot tub, but they usually had people in there whenever we walked by, so they must have been nice as well. This is definitely a great place to stay!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: The hotel room is very clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast smorgs are tasty and a great variety. The restaurant and cleaning staff are very friendly. The reception area folks could take a page from their book and learn from it. For the two nights and 3 days we were there, not once, was there any acknowledgement made to us, nor to anybody else that we witnessed, that passed the desk. This is the same observation that we made amongst ourselves the last time.
reviews.title: Comfy

reviews.text: We had actually made reservations at a nearby hotel but after finding "issues" with the cleanliness of exactly four rooms in a row we finally were just disgusted and checked out. We came over to check out the Hilton Garden Inn and just from the front lobby alone I could tell that this hotel had much higher standards and pride in their establishment. We checked in with no problems at all and found our room to be everything we needed. The fridge, microwave and comfortable beds were perfect. And I have to say that the room was immaculate. Obviously, housekeeping does a great job and follows the high standards that a good hotel should. What started out as a stressful, disappointing holiday turned out to be a completely enjoyable trip. I was really impressed with this hotel and it is now considered our go to place when visiting Edmonton.
reviews.title: So Impressed

reviews.text: This hotel is great . . . The location was awesome, the rooms were super clean, ALL linens are washed for every stay and the staff were amazing. Definitely stay here again but maybe try the second floor as that floor doesn't have the adjustable beds, I found the bed comfortable but my boyfriend didn't.
reviews.title: Great stay!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for one night, having never been disappointed by a Hilton before - and the streak continued.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the money

reviews.text: Very clean & comfortable, great location with many choices of restaurants in surroundig area, although in hotel dining is an option. Manfred really keeps an eye on helping the customers, steered me to the manager's reception, which was great. Absolutely nothing was deficient.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very conveniently located close to West Edmonton Mall and several excellent restaurants. It also has easy and quick access for travellers heading west from here. The hotel was clean, the bed was comfortable and overall, this is a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great location, very nice hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in a room that opened up to the pool area. The rooms and pool area were average. The restaurant and reception area were very nice and the food was very good. It's close to the Edmonton Mall if you're into shopping.
reviews.title: Average place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we found the hotel near the west edmonton mall to be ideal. Very clean, friendly staff very helpful. Nice pool.great breakfast buffet.A compact hotel with everything close by. Nice dining room. close to the highway ....
reviews.title: nice hotel near the mall

reviews.text: This place was spotlessly clean, the staff were fabulous, the premises were immaculate, and the location was very convenient to the West Edmonton Mall. We were surprised how large the rooms were. The pool was really good too, no frills, but clean and tidy always. Had some idiots one day...but you get that. Breakfast was particularly good - especially the servers, who all deserve a payrise. The coin laundry was a very, very, welcome bonus. Don't even think twice if you have to go to West Edmonton. We had a 'broken' credit card, and I think we had been there for three days before we managed to sort it out with our bank, and they were fine with it. That was nice.
reviews.title: A great hotel.

aka: Hilton Garden Inn West Edmonton Hotel
description: Hilton Garden Inn West Edmonton is 20 minutes away from Downtown Edmonton and only 5 minutes away from the West Edmonton Mall. It is located on 178th Street and Stony Plain Road. This vibrant hotel offers 160 beautifully appointed guest rooms, popular recreational facilities such as heated swimming pool and hot tub, reasonably priced fine dining service in the Great North American Grill, free Wi-Fi and local phone calls, only to list a few. The Hilton Garden Inn West Edmonton is sure to cater to your needs whether it for business or a nice getaway, "We Speak Success!"
